Class ScreenArtist

java.lang.Object
problem1.Artist
problem1.ScreenArtist
Direct Known Subclasses:
Actor, Dancer, Filmmaker
public abstract class ScreenArtist extends Artist
Abstract intermediate class representing artists whose work appears in screen-based media: movies, TV series, and other multimedia content.

This class serves as the shared superclass for Actor, Dancer, and Filmmaker. It captures the common fields and behavior for tracking screen-based credits, avoiding duplication across those concrete subclasses.

Relationship in the hierarchy: 
  Artist
    └── ScreenArtist  (abstract)
          ├── Actor
          ├── Dancer
          └── Filmmaker

  • Constructor Details

    • ScreenArtist

      public ScreenArtist(Name name, int age, String[] genres, String[] awards, String[] movies, String[] series, String[] otherMultimedia)
      Constructs a ScreenArtist with all base fields plus screen-media credits.
      Parameters:
      name - the artist's name; must not be null
      age - the artist's age; must be in [0, 128]
      genres - the artist's genres; must not be null
      awards - the artist's awards; must not be null
      movies - movies this artist worked on; must not be null
      series - TV series this artist worked on; must not be null
      otherMultimedia - other multimedia this artist worked on; must not be null
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if movies, series, or otherMultimedia is null

  • Method Details

    • getMovies

      public String[] getMovies()
      Returns a copy of the movies array.
      Returns:
      a defensive copy of the movies this artist has worked on

    • getSeries

      public String[] getSeries()
      Returns a copy of the TV series array.
      Returns:
      a defensive copy of the TV series this artist has worked on

    • getOtherMultimedia

      public String[] getOtherMultimedia()
      Returns a copy of the other multimedia array.
      Returns:
      a defensive copy of other multimedia content this artist has worked on

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation including screen-media credits in addition to the base Artist information.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Artist
      Returns:
      a formatted string describing this screen artist
